page.title: 07TRELLECH QUARRY,LYDART
page.content: This small quarry,on the northern side of Trellech Hill,has been operated by a succession of licensees, but their profitability has been subject to the vagaries of the local economic climate. This site is noteworthy for the acid quartzite aggregate that is the product of eroded puddingstone or quartz conglomerate. The loose rock is extracted,washed and graded as sand, pea gravel and gravel. The lack of alkaline chemicals means that the aggregate can be used as a bedding for underground pipes or for construction,where alkaline corrosion would be unacceptable. The pea gravel is used in large quantities by nurseries to make up an acidic potting compost for those plant groups such as rhododendrons and heathers which demand lime free soils.
